meanings.definition: The state of being undecided or unresolved.
meanings.sent1: The pendency of the matter left everyone in suspense.
meanings.sent2: The pendency of the case caused delays in the court proceedings.
meanings.sent3: The pendency of the decision made for an interesting cliffhanger.
meanings.sent4: The pendency of the issue hung over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The pendency of the question lingered in their minds long after the meeting.

meanings.definition: Something that is pending or awaiting a decision.
meanings.sent1: The pendency of the approval kept the project on hold.
meanings.sent2: The pendency of the document required immediate attention.
meanings.sent3: The pendency of the request added a sense of anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The pendency of the application loomed large in their minds.
meanings.sent5: The pendency of the outcome created a sense of urgency among the team.
